  • Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) with OWASP ZAP and GitHub Actions

Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) with OWASP ZAP and GitHub Actions

This comprehensive guide covers implementing Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) in your CI/CD pipeline using OWASP ZAP and GitHub Actions to automatically detect security vulnerabilities in running applications.

Overview​

Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) is a security testing approach that analyzes running applications to identify vulnerabilities that could be exploited by attackers. Unlike Static Application Security Testing (SAST), DAST tests applications from the outside, simulating real-world attack scenarios.

Benefits of DAST​

  • Runtime Vulnerability Detection: Identifies issues only visible when the application is running
  • Real-world Testing: Tests the application as an attacker would see it
  • Technology Agnostic: Works with any web application regardless of programming language
  • Configuration Issues: Detects server misconfigurations and deployment issues
  • Authentication Testing: Can test authenticated areas of applications

OWASP ZAP (Zed Attack Proxy)​

OWASP ZAP is a free, open-source web application security scanner maintained by the OWASP Foundation. It's designed to be used by both beginners and security professionals.

Key Features​

  • Automated Scanning: Passive and active security scanning
  • Manual Testing: Interactive proxy for manual security testing
  • API Support: REST API and command-line interface
  • Extensible: Plugin architecture with marketplace
  • CI/CD Integration: Docker images and automation scripts

Implementation Strategy​

1. DAST Integration Levels​

graph TD
    A[Development] --> B[Pull Request]
    B --> C[DAST Baseline Scan]
    C --> D[Merge to Main]
    D --> E[Full DAST Scan]
    E --> F[Security Report]
    F --> G[Deployment Gate]

2. Scanning Approaches​

  • Baseline Scan: Quick scan for common vulnerabilities
  • Full Scan: Comprehensive security assessment
  • API Scan: Specialized scanning for REST/GraphQL APIs
  • Authenticated Scan: Testing with user credentials

GitHub Actions Implementation​

1. Basic OWASP ZAP Workflow​

Create .github/workflows/dast-scan.yml:

name: DAST Security Scan

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]
  schedule:
    # Run daily at 2 AM UTC
    - cron: '0 2 * * *'

env:
  TARGET_URL: ${{ secrets.TARGET_URL || 'http://localhost:3000' }}

jobs:
  dast-scan:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    name: DAST Security Scan
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup application
      run: |
        # Start your application (example with Docker)
        docker-compose up -d
        
        # Wait for application to be ready
        timeout 300 bash -c 'until curl -f ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}/health; do sleep 5; done'
    
    - name: Run OWASP ZAP Baseline Scan
      uses: zaproxy/action-baseline@v0.10.0
      with:
        target: ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}
        rules_file_name: '.zap/rules/baseline.tsv'
        cmd_options: '-a'
        
    - name: Upload ZAP results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      if: always()
      with:
        name: zap-baseline-report
        path: report_html.html
        
    - name: Create security issue
      if: failure()
      uses: actions/github-script@v7
      with:
        script: |
          const fs = require('fs');
          const report = fs.readFileSync('report_html.html', 'utf8');
          
          github.rest.issues.create({
            owner: context.repo.owner,
            repo: context.repo.repo,
            title: 'DAST Security Vulnerabilities Detected',
            body: `## Security Scan Results
            
            DAST scan has detected security vulnerabilities in the application.
            
            **Scan Details:**
            - Target: ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}
            - Commit: ${{ github.sha }}
            - Branch: ${{ github.ref_name }}
            
            Please review the detailed report in the artifacts.`,
            labels: ['security', 'vulnerability', 'dast']
          });

2. Advanced Multi-Stage DAST Pipeline​

Create .github/workflows/advanced-dast.yml:

name: Advanced DAST Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

env:
  REGISTRY: ghcr.io
  IMAGE_NAME: ${{ github.repository }}

jobs:
  build-and-deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      app-url: ${{ steps.deploy.outputs.app-url }}
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Build application
      run: |
        docker build -t test-app .
        
    - name: Deploy to test environment
      id: deploy
      run: |
        # Deploy to staging/test environment
        docker run -d -p 3000:3000 --name test-app test-app
        echo "app-url=http://localhost:3000" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        
        # Health check
        timeout 120 bash -c 'until curl -f http://localhost:3000/health; do sleep 2; done'

  baseline-scan:
    needs: build-and-deploy
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: ZAP Baseline Scan
      uses: zaproxy/action-baseline@v0.10.0
      with:
        target: ${{ needs.build-and-deploy.outputs.app-url }}
        rules_file_name: '.zap/rules/baseline.tsv'
        cmd_options: '-a -j -m 2 -T 5'
        
    - name: Upload baseline results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      if: always()
      with:
        name: zap-baseline-results
        path: |
          report_html.html
          report_json.json

  full-scan:
    needs: build-and-deploy
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: ZAP Full Scan
      uses: zaproxy/action-full-scan@v0.8.0
      with:
        target: ${{ needs.build-and-deploy.outputs.app-url }}
        rules_file_name: '.zap/rules/full-scan.tsv'
        cmd_options: '-a -j -m 10 -T 60'
        
    - name: Upload full scan results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      if: always()
      with:
        name: zap-full-scan-results
        path: |
          report_html.html
          report_json.json
          
    - name: Process results
      run: |
        # Parse JSON report for metrics
        python3 .github/scripts/process-zap-results.py report_json.json

  api-scan:
    needs: build-and-deploy
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Generate OpenAPI spec
      run: |
        # Generate or copy OpenAPI specification
        curl ${{ needs.build-and-deploy.outputs.app-url }}/api/docs/json > openapi.json
        
    - name: ZAP API Scan
      uses: zaproxy/action-api-scan@v0.6.0
      with:
        target: ${{ needs.build-and-deploy.outputs.app-url }}
        format: openapi
        api_file: openapi.json
        cmd_options: '-a -j'
        
    - name: Upload API scan results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      if: always()
      with:
        name: zap-api-scan-results
        path: |
          report_html.html
          report_json.json

  security-gate:
    needs: [baseline-scan, full-scan, api-scan]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    
    steps:
    - name: Download all artifacts
      uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
      
    - name: Security gate check
      run: |
        # Process all scan results
        python3 .github/scripts/security-gate.py \
          --baseline zap-baseline-results/report_json.json \
          --full zap-full-scan-results/report_json.json \
          --api zap-api-scan-results/report_json.json \
          --threshold-high 0 \
          --threshold-medium 5

3. Authenticated DAST Scanning​

Create .github/workflows/auth-dast.yml:

name: Authenticated DAST Scan

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 6 * * 1'  # Weekly on Monday
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  authenticated-scan:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup test environment
      run: |
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.test.yml up -d
        sleep 30
        
    - name: Create test user
      run: |
        # Create test user account
        curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/api/users \
          -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
          -d '{"username":"testuser","password":"TestPass123!","email":"test@example.com"}'
        
    - name: Run authenticated ZAP scan
      run: |
        docker run --rm \
          --network host \
          -v $(pwd)/.zap/auth:/zap/auth \
          -v $(pwd)/.zap/context:/zap/context \
          -v $(pwd)/reports:/zap/reports \
          owasp/zap2docker-stable \
          zap-full-scan.py \
          -t http://localhost:3000 \
          -n /zap/context/default.context \
          -U testuser \
          -z "-config api.addrs.addr.name=.* -config api.addrs.addr.regex=true" \
          -J zap-auth-report.json \
          -H zap-auth-report.html
          
    - name: Upload authenticated scan results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      if: always()
      with:
        name: authenticated-scan-results
        path: reports/

4. Advanced OWASP ZAP with Action-AF (Auto-Filter)​

The zaproxy/action-af@v0.2.0 action provides advanced automation and filtering capabilities for ZAP scans, including intelligent vulnerability filtering, custom rules, and enhanced reporting features.

Key Features of Action-AF​

  • Intelligent Filtering: Automatically filters false positives and duplicates
  • Custom Rule Engine: Define custom security rules and policies
  • Advanced Reporting: Enhanced HTML/JSON reports with filtering details
  • Baseline Comparison: Compare scan results against previous baselines
  • Risk Assessment: Automated risk scoring and prioritization
  • CI/CD Integration: Seamless integration with deployment pipelines

Basic Action-AF Implementation​

Create .github/workflows/zap-action-af.yml:

name: ZAP Advanced Filtering Scan

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      target_url:
        description: 'Target URL to scan'
        required: true
        default: 'https://example.com'
      scan_type:
        description: 'Type of scan to perform'
        required: true
        default: 'baseline'
        type: choice
        options:
        - baseline
        - full
        - api

env:
  TARGET_URL: ${{ github.event.inputs.target_url || 'http://localhost:3000' }}
  SCAN_TYPE: ${{ github.event.inputs.scan_type || 'baseline' }}

jobs:
  zap-af-scan:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    name: ZAP Advanced Filtering Scan
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup application environment
      if: env.TARGET_URL == 'http://localhost:3000'
      run: |
        # Start application for testing
        docker-compose -f docker-compose.test.yml up -d
        
        # Wait for application to be ready
        timeout 120 bash -c 'until curl -f ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}/health; do sleep 5; done'
        
        # Seed test data if needed
        curl -X POST ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}/api/test/seed
    
    - name: ZAP Action-AF Baseline Scan
      if: env.SCAN_TYPE == 'baseline'
      uses: zaproxy/action-af@v0.2.0
      with:
        target: ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}
        scan_type: 'baseline'
        rules_file_name: '.zap/rules/baseline-af.json'
        filter_file_name: '.zap/filters/baseline-filters.json'
        cmd_options: >-
          -a
          -j
          -m 2
          -T 5
          -z "-config api.addrs.addr.name=.* -config api.addrs.addr.regex=true"
        fail_action: 'warn'
        allow_issue_writing: true
        
    - name: ZAP Action-AF Full Scan
      if: env.SCAN_TYPE == 'full'
      uses: zaproxy/action-af@v0.2.0
      with:
        target: ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}
        scan_type: 'full'
        rules_file_name: '.zap/rules/full-scan-af.json'
        filter_file_name: '.zap/filters/full-scan-filters.json'
        cmd_options: >-
          -a
          -j
          -m 10
          -T 60
          -z "-config spider.maxDuration=30 -config scanner.maxScanDurationInMins=60"
        fail_action: 'error'
        allow_issue_writing: true
        issue_title: 'ZAP Full Scan Security Issues Detected'
        
    - name: ZAP Action-AF API Scan
      if: env.SCAN_TYPE == 'api'
      uses: zaproxy/action-af@v0.2.0
      with:
        target: ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}
        scan_type: 'api'
        api_spec: '.zap/specs/openapi.yaml'
        rules_file_name: '.zap/rules/api-scan-af.json'
        filter_file_name: '.zap/filters/api-filters.json'
        cmd_options: >-
          -a
          -j
          -z "-config api.addrs.addr.name=.* -config api.addrs.addr.regex=true"
        fail_action: 'warn'
        allow_issue_writing: false
        
    - name: Upload ZAP Action-AF Results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      if: always()
      with:
        name: zap-af-scan-results-${{ env.SCAN_TYPE }}
        path: |
          report_html.html
          report_json.json
          report_md.md
          zap_af_summary.json
          
    - name: Comment PR with Results
      if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
      uses: actions/github-script@v7
      with:
        script: |
          const fs = require('fs');
          
          try {
            const summary = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync('zap_af_summary.json', 'utf8'));
            const markdownReport = fs.readFileSync('report_md.md', 'utf8');
            
            const comment = `## 🔒 ZAP Action-AF Security Scan Results
            
            **Scan Type:** \`${{ env.SCAN_TYPE }}\`
            **Target:** \`${{ env.TARGET_URL }}\`
            **Commit:** \`${{ github.sha }}\`
            
            ### Summary
            - **Total Alerts:** ${summary.total_alerts}
            - **High Risk:** ${summary.high_risk}
            - **Medium Risk:** ${summary.medium_risk}
            - **Low Risk:** ${summary.low_risk}
            - **Informational:** ${summary.informational}
            - **Filtered Alerts:** ${summary.filtered_alerts}
            
            ### Filter Statistics
            - **False Positives Filtered:** ${summary.false_positives_filtered}
            - **Duplicates Removed:** ${summary.duplicates_removed}
            - **Risk Level Adjustments:** ${summary.risk_adjustments}
            
            <details>
            <summary>📋 Detailed Report</summary>
            
            ${markdownReport}
            
            </details>
            
            For complete results, check the [workflow artifacts](${{ github.server_url }}/${{ github.repository }}/actions/runs/${{ github.run_id }}).
            `;
            
            github.rest.issues.createComment({
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              body: comment
            });
          } catch (error) {
            console.log('Could not post comment:', error.message);
          }

Production-Ready Action-AF Configuration​

Create .github/workflows/production-zap-af.yml:

name: Production ZAP Action-AF Pipeline

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 2 * * 1,3,5'  # Monday, Wednesday, Friday at 2 AM
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      environment:
        description: 'Environment to scan'
        required: true
        default: 'staging'
        type: choice
        options:
        - staging
        - production
      scan_depth:
        description: 'Scan depth level'
        required: true
        default: 'standard'
        type: choice
        options:
        - quick
        - standard
        - deep

jobs:
  matrix-scan:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        scan_type: [baseline, full, api]
        environment: [staging, production]
      fail-fast: false
      
    name: ZAP AF ${{ matrix.scan_type }} - ${{ matrix.environment }}
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Set environment variables
      run: |
        case "${{ matrix.environment }}" in
          staging)
            echo "TARGET_URL=${{ secrets.STAGING_URL }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            echo "AUTH_TOKEN=${{ secrets.STAGING_TOKEN }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            ;;
          production)
            echo "TARGET_URL=${{ secrets.PRODUCTION_URL }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            echo "AUTH_TOKEN=${{ secrets.PRODUCTION_TOKEN }}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            ;;
        esac
        
        case "${{ github.event.inputs.scan_depth || 'standard' }}" in
          quick)
            echo "SCAN_TIMEOUT=5" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            echo "MAX_DURATION=10" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            ;;
          standard)
            echo "SCAN_TIMEOUT=15" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            echo "MAX_DURATION=30" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            ;;
          deep)
            echo "SCAN_TIMEOUT=30" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            echo "MAX_DURATION=120" >> $GITHUB_ENV
            ;;
        esac
    
    - name: Download baseline data
      run: |
        # Download previous scan results for comparison
        gh api repos/${{ github.repository }}/actions/artifacts \
          --jq '.artifacts[] | select(.name | contains("baseline-${{ matrix.environment }}")) | .archive_download_url' \
          | head -1 \
          | xargs -I {} gh api {} > previous-baseline.zip || true
          
        if [ -f previous-baseline.zip ]; then
          unzip -q previous-baseline.zip -d previous-results/ || true
        fi
      env:
        GH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
    
    - name: ZAP Action-AF Production Scan
      uses: zaproxy/action-af@v0.2.0
      with:
        target: ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}
        scan_type: ${{ matrix.scan_type }}
        rules_file_name: '.zap/rules/${{ matrix.environment }}-${{ matrix.scan_type }}-af.json'
        filter_file_name: '.zap/filters/${{ matrix.environment }}-filters.json'
        baseline_file_name: 'previous-results/report_json.json'
        cmd_options: >-
          -a
          -j
          -T ${{ env.SCAN_TIMEOUT }}
          -z "-config spider.maxDuration=${{ env.MAX_DURATION }}
              -config scanner.maxScanDurationInMins=${{ env.MAX_DURATION }}
              -config api.addrs.addr.name=.*
              -config api.addrs.addr.regex=true"
        auth_header_name: 'Authorization'
        auth_header_value: 'Bearer ${{ env.AUTH_TOKEN }}'
        fail_action: ${{ matrix.environment == 'production' && 'error' || 'warn' }}
        allow_issue_writing: true
        issue_title: 'ZAP ${{ matrix.scan_type }} Security Issues - ${{ matrix.environment }}'
        issue_labels: 'security,zap,${{ matrix.scan_type }},${{ matrix.environment }}'
        
    - name: Process and enhance results
      run: |
        # Create enhanced summary with trend analysis
        python3 .github/scripts/enhance-zap-af-results.py \
          --current report_json.json \
          --baseline previous-results/report_json.json \
          --environment ${{ matrix.environment }} \
          --scan-type ${{ matrix.scan_type }} \
          --output enhanced-summary.json
          
    - name: Upload results with retention
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: zap-af-${{ matrix.environment }}-${{ matrix.scan_type }}-${{ github.run_number }}
        path: |
          report_html.html
          report_json.json
          report_md.md
          zap_af_summary.json
          enhanced-summary.json
        retention-days: ${{ matrix.environment == 'production' && 90 || 30 }}
        
    - name: Update security dashboard
      if: matrix.environment == 'production'
      run: |
        # Update security metrics dashboard
        curl -X POST "${{ secrets.SECURITY_DASHBOARD_URL }}/api/zap-results" \
          -H "Authorization: Bearer ${{ secrets.DASHBOARD_TOKEN }}" \
          -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
          -d @enhanced-summary.json
          
    - name: Notify security team
      if: matrix.environment == 'production' && contains(fromJSON(steps.zap-scan.outputs.summary).high_risk, '0') == false
      uses: 8398a7/action-slack@v3
      with:
        status: custom
        custom_payload: |
          {
            attachments: [{
              color: 'danger',
              title: 'High Risk Security Issues Detected',
              fields: [{
                title: 'Environment',
                value: '${{ matrix.environment }}',
                short: true
              }, {
                title: 'Scan Type',
                value: '${{ matrix.scan_type }}',
                short: true
              }, {
                title: 'High Risk Issues',
                value: '${{ fromJSON(steps.zap-scan.outputs.summary).high_risk }}',
                short: true
              }],
              actions: [{
                type: 'button',
                text: 'View Results',
                url: '${{ github.server_url }}/${{ github.repository }}/actions/runs/${{ github.run_id }}'
              }]
            }]
          }
      env:
        SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL: ${{ secrets.SLACK_SECURITY_WEBHOOK }}

  consolidate-results:
    needs: matrix-scan
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    
    steps:
    - name: Download all scan results
      uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
      with:
        pattern: zap-af-*-${{ github.run_number }}
        merge-multiple: true
        
    - name: Generate consolidated security report
      run: |
        python3 .github/scripts/consolidate-zap-af-results.py \
          --input-dir . \
          --output consolidated-security-report.html \
          --json-output consolidated-results.json
          
    - name: Upload consolidated report
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: consolidated-security-report-${{ github.run_number }}
        path: |
          consolidated-security-report.html
          consolidated-results.json
        retention-days: 180

Action-AF Configuration Files​

Baseline Rules Configuration (.zap/rules/baseline-af.json)​
{
  "scan_policy": {
    "name": "Baseline-AF Policy",
    "description": "Advanced filtering baseline scan policy",
    "scanner_config": {
      "attack_strength": "MEDIUM",
      "alert_threshold": "MEDIUM",
      "scan_speed": "FAST"
    }
  },
  "rules": {
    "enabled_scanners": [
      "10003", // Persistent XSS (Prime)
      "10004", // Persistent XSS (Spider)
      "10005", // Persistent XSS (Tag)
      "10006", // Persistent XSS (Attribute)
      "10015", // Vulnerable JS Library
      "10020", // X-Frame-Options Missing
      "10021", // X-Content-Type-Options Missing
      "10023", // Information Disclosure - Debug Error Messages
      "10025", // Information Disclosure - Sensitive Information in URL
      "10027", // Information Disclosure - Suspicious Comments
      "10032", // Viewstate Scanner
      "10035", // Strict-Transport-Security Missing
      "10036", // Server Leaks Version Information
      "10040", // Secure Pages Include Mixed Content
      "10041", // HTTP to HTTPS Insecure Transition
      "10042", // HTTPS to HTTP Insecure Transition
      "10043", // User Controllable JavaScript Event
      "10048", // Remote Code Execution - Shell Shock
      "10049", // Content Cacheability
      "10050", // Retrieved from Cache
      "10051", // Relative Path Overwrite
      "10052", // X-ChromeLogger-Data Header Information Leak
      "10054", // Cookie without SameSite Attribute
      "10055", // CSP Scanner
      "10056", // X-Debug-Token Information Leak
      "10057", // Username Hash Found
      "10061", // X-AspNet-Version Response Header
      "10062", // PII Scanner
      "10063", // Permissions Policy Header Not Set
      "10094", // Base64 Disclosure
      "10095", // Backup File Disclosure
      "10096", // Timestamp Disclosure
      "10097", // Hash Disclosure
      "10098", // Cross-Domain Misconfiguration
      "10105", // Weak Authentication Method
      "10108", // Reverse Tabnabbing
      "10109", // Modern Web Application
      "10110"  // Dangerous JS Functions
    ],
    "disabled_scanners": [],
    "custom_rules": [
      {
        "rule_id": "CUSTOM_001",
        "name": "Custom Authentication Bypass Check",
        "description": "Checks for authentication bypass vulnerabilities",
        "pattern": "(?i)(admin|root|test|guest):(admin|root|test|guest|password|123456)",
        "risk_level": "HIGH"
      },
      {
        "rule_id": "CUSTOM_002", 
        "name": "API Key Exposure",
        "description": "Detects exposed API keys in responses",
        "pattern": "(?i)(api[_-]?key|apikey|access[_-]?token)\\s*[:=]\\s*['\"]?([a-zA-Z0-9]{20,})",
        "risk_level": "HIGH"
      }
    ]

    "risk_threshold": "LOW",
    "false_positive_patterns": [
      "jQuery.*version.*detected",

Processing Scripts​

1. Results Processing Script​

Create .github/scripts/process-zap-results.py:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Process OWASP ZAP scan results and generate metrics.
"""

import json
import sys
import os
from datetime import datetime

def process_zap_results(report_file):
    """Process ZAP JSON report and extract key metrics."""
    try:
        with open(report_file, 'r') as f:
            data = json.load(f)
    except FileNotFoundError:
        print(f"Report file not found: {report_file}")
        return False
    except json.JSONDecodeError:
        print(f"Invalid JSON in report file: {report_file}")
        return False

    # Extract site information
    site = data.get('site', [{}])[0]
    alerts = site.get('alerts', [])
    
    # Count vulnerabilities by risk level
    risk_counts = {
        'High': 0,
        'Medium': 0,
        'Low': 0,
        'Informational': 0
    }
    
    vulnerability_details = []
    
    for alert in alerts:
        risk = alert.get('riskdesc', 'Unknown')
        risk_level = risk.split(' ')[0] if ' ' in risk else risk
        
        if risk_level in risk_counts:
            risk_counts[risk_level] += 1
        
        vulnerability_details.append({
            'name': alert.get('name', 'Unknown'),
            'risk': risk_level,
            'confidence': alert.get('confidence', 'Unknown'),
            'description': alert.get('desc', ''),
            'solution': alert.get('solution', ''),
            'instances': len(alert.get('instances', []))
        })
    
    # Generate summary
    total_vulnerabilities = sum(risk_counts.values())
    critical_issues = risk_counts['High'] + risk_counts['Medium']
    
    print(f"=== DAST Scan Results Summary ===")
    print(f"Total Vulnerabilities: {total_vulnerabilities}")
    print(f"High Risk: {risk_counts['High']}")
    print(f"Medium Risk: {risk_counts['Medium']}")
    print(f"Low Risk: {risk_counts['Low']}")
    print(f"Informational: {risk_counts['Informational']}")
    print(f"Critical Issues (High + Medium): {critical_issues}")
    
    # Set GitHub Actions outputs
    if os.getenv('GITHUB_ACTIONS'):
        with open(os.environ['GITHUB_OUTPUT'], 'a') as f:
            f.write(f"total-vulnerabilities={total_vulnerabilities}\n")
            f.write(f"high-risk={risk_counts['High']}\n")
            f.write(f"medium-risk={risk_counts['Medium']}\n")
            f.write(f"low-risk={risk_counts['Low']}\n")
            f.write(f"critical-issues={critical_issues}\n")
    
    # Generate detailed report
    generate_markdown_report(vulnerability_details, risk_counts)
    
    return True

def generate_markdown_report(vulnerabilities, risk_counts):
    """Generate a markdown report of vulnerabilities."""
    timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")
    
    report = f"""# DAST Security Scan Report

**Generated:** {timestamp}

## Summary

| Risk Level | Count |
|------------|-------|
| High | {risk_counts['High']} |
| Medium | {risk_counts['Medium']} |
| Low | {risk_counts['Low']} |
| Informational | {risk_counts['Informational']} |

## Vulnerability Details

"""
    
    # Group vulnerabilities by risk level
    for risk_level in ['High', 'Medium', 'Low', 'Informational']:
        risk_vulns = [v for v in vulnerabilities if v['risk'] == risk_level]
        
        if risk_vulns:
            report += f"\n### {risk_level} Risk Vulnerabilities\n\n"
            
            for vuln in risk_vulns:
                report += f"#### {vuln['name']}\n\n"
                report += f"- **Risk:** {vuln['risk']}\n"
                report += f"- **Confidence:** {vuln['confidence']}\n"
                report += f"- **Instances:** {vuln['instances']}\n\n"
                
                if vuln['description']:
                    report += f"**Description:** {vuln['description']}\n\n"
                
                if vuln['solution']:
                    report += f"**Solution:** {vuln['solution']}\n\n"
                
                report += "---\n\n"
    
    # Write report to file
    with open('dast-report.md', 'w') as f:
        f.write(report)
    
    print(f"Detailed report generated: dast-report.md")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    if len(sys.argv) != 2:
        print("Usage: python3 process-zap-results.py <report.json>")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    report_file = sys.argv[1]
    success = process_zap_results(report_file)
    
    if not success:
        sys.exit(1)

2. Security Gate Script​

Create .github/scripts/security-gate.py:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Security gate for DAST scan results.
Fails the build if vulnerability thresholds are exceeded.
"""

import json
import sys
import argparse

def check_security_gate(reports, thresholds):
    """Check if security thresholds are met."""
    total_high = 0
    total_medium = 0
    total_low = 0
    
    for report_file in reports:
        if not report_file:
            continue
            
        try:
            with open(report_file, 'r') as f:
                data = json.load(f)
        except (FileNotFoundError, json.JSONDecodeError) as e:
            print(f"Error reading {report_file}: {e}")
            continue
        
        # Count vulnerabilities
        site = data.get('site', [{}])[0]
        alerts = site.get('alerts', [])
        
        for alert in alerts:
            risk = alert.get('riskdesc', '').lower()
            if 'high' in risk:
                total_high += 1
            elif 'medium' in risk:
                total_medium += 1
            elif 'low' in risk:
                total_low += 1
    
    print(f"Security Gate Results:")
    print(f"High Risk Vulnerabilities: {total_high} (threshold: {thresholds['high']})")
    print(f"Medium Risk Vulnerabilities: {total_medium} (threshold: {thresholds['medium']})")
    print(f"Low Risk Vulnerabilities: {total_low} (threshold: {thresholds['low']})")
    
    # Check thresholds
    gate_passed = True
    
    if total_high > thresholds['high']:
        print(f"❌ SECURITY GATE FAILED: High risk vulnerabilities ({total_high}) exceed threshold ({thresholds['high']})")
        gate_passed = False
    
    if total_medium > thresholds['medium']:
        print(f"❌ SECURITY GATE FAILED: Medium risk vulnerabilities ({total_medium}) exceed threshold ({thresholds['medium']})")
        gate_passed = False
    
    if total_low > thresholds['low']:
        print(f"⚠️  WARNING: Low risk vulnerabilities ({total_low}) exceed threshold ({thresholds['low']})")
        # Low risk doesn't fail the gate by default
    
    if gate_passed:
        print("✅ SECURITY GATE PASSED: All thresholds met")
        return True
    else:
        print("❌ SECURITY GATE FAILED: Security thresholds exceeded")
        return False

def main():
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Security gate for DAST results')
    parser.add_argument('--baseline', help='Baseline scan report')
    parser.add_argument('--full', help='Full scan report')
    parser.add_argument('--api', help='API scan report')
    parser.add_argument('--threshold-high', type=int, default=0, help='High risk threshold')
    parser.add_argument('--threshold-medium', type=int, default=5, help='Medium risk threshold')
    parser.add_argument('--threshold-low', type=int, default=20, help='Low risk threshold')
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    reports = [args.baseline, args.full, args.api]
    thresholds = {
        'high': args.threshold_high,
        'medium': args.threshold_medium,
        'low': args.threshold_low
    }
    
    success = check_security_gate(reports, thresholds)
    
    if not success:
        sys.exit(1)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

3. Action-AF Results Enhancement Script​

Create .github/scripts/enhance-zap-af-results.py:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Enhanced processing script for ZAP Action-AF results with trend analysis.
"""

import json
import sys
import argparse
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from typing import Dict, List, Optional, Any

class ZAPAFResultsProcessor:
    def __init__(self):
        self.current_results = None
        self.baseline_results = None
        self.enhanced_summary = {}
        
    def load_results(self, current_file: str, baseline_file: Optional[str] = None):
        """Load current and baseline ZAP results."""
        try:
            with open(current_file, 'r') as f:
                self.current_results = json.load(f)
        except (FileNotFoundError, json.JSONDecodeError) as e:
            print(f"Error loading current results: {e}")
            return False
            
        if baseline_file:
            try:
                with open(baseline_file, 'r') as f:
                    self.baseline_results = json.load(f)
            except (FileNotFoundError, json.JSONDecodeError):
                print(f"Baseline file not found or invalid: {baseline_file}")
                self.baseline_results = None
                
        return True
    
    def extract_alerts(self, results: Dict) -> List[Dict]:
        """Extract alerts from ZAP results."""
        if not results:
            return []
            
        site = results.get('site', [{}])[0]
        return site.get('alerts', [])
    
    def categorize_alerts(self, alerts: List[Dict]) -> Dict[str, List[Dict]]:
        """Categorize alerts by risk level."""
        categories = {
            'High': [],
            'Medium': [],
            'Low': [],
            'Informational': []
        }
        
        for alert in alerts:
            risk_desc = alert.get('riskdesc', 'Unknown')
            risk_level = risk_desc.split(' ')[0] if ' ' in risk_desc else 'Informational'
            
            if risk_level in categories:
                categories[risk_level].append(alert)
            else:
                categories['Informational'].append(alert)
                
        return categories
    
    def analyze_trends(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Analyze trends between current and baseline results."""
        trend_analysis = {
            'new_issues': [],
            'resolved_issues': [],
            'recurring_issues': [],
            'risk_changes': []
        }
        
        if not self.baseline_results:
            return trend_analysis
            
        current_alerts = self.extract_alerts(self.current_results)
        baseline_alerts = self.extract_alerts(self.baseline_results)
        
        # Create alert signatures for comparison
        current_signatures = {self._create_alert_signature(alert): alert for alert in current_alerts}
        baseline_signatures = {self._create_alert_signature(alert): alert for alert in baseline_alerts}
        
        # Find new issues
        for sig, alert in current_signatures.items():
            if sig not in baseline_signatures:
                trend_analysis['new_issues'].append(alert)
            else:
                # Check for risk level changes
                baseline_risk = baseline_signatures[sig].get('riskdesc', '')
                current_risk = alert.get('riskdesc', '')
                if baseline_risk != current_risk:
                    trend_analysis['risk_changes'].append({
                        'alert': alert,
                        'previous_risk': baseline_risk,
                        'current_risk': current_risk
                    })
                else:
                    trend_analysis['recurring_issues'].append(alert)
        
        # Find resolved issues
        for sig, alert in baseline_signatures.items():
            if sig not in current_signatures:
                trend_analysis['resolved_issues'].append(alert)
                
        return trend_analysis
    
    def _create_alert_signature(self, alert: Dict) -> str:
        """Create a unique signature for an alert based on key attributes."""
        name = alert.get('name', '')
        plugin_id = alert.get('pluginid', '')
        url = alert.get('instances', [{}])[0].get('uri', '') if alert.get('instances') else ''
        return f"{plugin_id}:{name}:{url}"
    
    def calculate_confidence_metrics(self, alerts: List[Dict]) -> Dict[str, int]:
        """Calculate confidence-based metrics for alerts."""
        confidence_counts = {
            'High': 0,
            'Medium': 0,
            'Low': 0
        }
        
        for alert in alerts:
            confidence = alert.get('confidence', 'Medium')
            if confidence in confidence_counts:
                confidence_counts[confidence] += 1
                
        return confidence_counts
    
    def analyze_coverage(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Analyze scan coverage and completeness."""
        if not self.current_results:
            return {}
            
        site = self.current_results.get('site', [{}])[0]
        
        coverage = {
            'total_urls_scanned': len(site.get('urls', [])),
            'scan_duration': self._extract_scan_duration(),
            'technologies_detected': self._extract_technologies(),
            'authentication_status': self._check_authentication_coverage()
        }
        
        return coverage
    
    def _extract_scan_duration(self) -> str:
        """Extract scan duration from results."""
        # This would depend on the specific structure of Action-AF results
        return "Unknown"
    
    def _extract_technologies(self) -> List[str]:
        """Extract detected technologies."""
        technologies = []
        current_alerts = self.extract_alerts(self.current_results)
        
        for alert in current_alerts:
            if 'technology' in alert.get('name', '').lower():
                tech_info = alert.get('desc', '')
                technologies.append(tech_info)
                
        return list(set(technologies))
    
    def _check_authentication_coverage(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Check authentication coverage in scan."""
        auth_coverage = {
            'authenticated_urls': 0,
            'unauthenticated_urls': 0,
            'auth_bypass_attempts': 0
        }
        
        # This would be enhanced based on Action-AF specific features
        return auth_coverage
    
    def generate_enhanced_summary(self, environment: str, scan_type: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Generate comprehensive enhanced summary."""
        current_alerts = self.extract_alerts(self.current_results)
        categorized = self.categorize_alerts(current_alerts)
        trends = self.analyze_trends()
        confidence_metrics = self.calculate_confidence_metrics(current_alerts)
        coverage = self.analyze_coverage()
        
        self.enhanced_summary = {
            'metadata': {
                'scan_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(),
                'environment': environment,
                'scan_type': scan_type,
                'zap_version': self.current_results.get('@version', 'Unknown'),
                'action_af_version': 'v0.2.0'
            },
            'summary': {
                'total_alerts': len(current_alerts),
                'high_risk': len(categorized['High']),
                'medium_risk': len(categorized['Medium']),
                'low_risk': len(categorized['Low']),
                'informational': len(categorized['Informational'])
            },
            'confidence_metrics': confidence_metrics,
            'trend_analysis': {
                'new_issues_count': len(trends['new_issues']),
                'resolved_issues_count': len(trends['resolved_issues']),
                'recurring_issues_count': len(trends['recurring_issues']),
                'risk_changes_count': len(trends['risk_changes']),
                'new_issues': trends['new_issues'][:5],  # Top 5 for summary
                'resolved_issues': trends['resolved_issues'][:5],
                'risk_changes': trends['risk_changes']
            },
            'coverage_analysis': coverage,
            'recommendations': self._generate_recommendations(categorized, trends),
            'compliance_status': self._assess_compliance(categorized),
            'action_items': self._generate_action_items(categorized, trends)
        }
        
        return self.enhanced_summary
    
    def _generate_recommendations(self, categorized: Dict, trends: Dict) -> List[str]:
        """Generate actionable recommendations."""
        recommendations = []
        
        if categorized['High']:
            recommendations.append(f"Address {len(categorized['High'])} high-risk vulnerabilities immediately")
            
        if len(trends['new_issues']) > 5:
            recommendations.append("Investigate cause of multiple new security issues")
            
        if trends['risk_changes']:
            recommendations.append("Review risk level changes for potential false positives")
            
        if categorized['Medium'] and len(categorized['Medium']) > 10:
            recommendations.append("Consider batch remediation for medium-risk issues")
            
        return recommendations
    
    def _assess_compliance(self, categorized: Dict) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Assess compliance with security standards."""
        compliance = {
            'owasp_top_10': self._check_owasp_compliance(categorized),
            'pci_dss': self._check_pci_compliance(categorized),
            'overall_score': 0
        }
        
        # Calculate overall score (0-100)
        high_penalty = len(categorized['High']) * 20
        medium_penalty = len(categorized['Medium']) * 5
        low_penalty = len(categorized['Low']) * 1
        
        total_penalty = min(100, high_penalty + medium_penalty + low_penalty)
        compliance['overall_score'] = max(0, 100 - total_penalty)
        
        return compliance
    
    def _check_owasp_compliance(self, categorized: Dict) -> Dict[str, bool]:
        """Check OWASP Top 10 compliance."""
        # Simplified compliance check
        return {
            'injection': len([a for a in categorized['High'] if 'injection' in a.get('name', '').lower()]) == 0,
            'xss': len([a for a in categorized['High'] if 'xss' in a.get('name', '').lower()]) == 0,
            'security_misconfiguration': len([a for a in categorized['High'] if 'configuration' in a.get('name', '').lower()]) == 0
        }
    
    def _check_pci_compliance(self, categorized: Dict) -> bool:
        """Check basic PCI DSS compliance."""
        # Simplified PCI check
        return len(categorized['High']) == 0 and len(categorized['Medium']) < 5
    
    def _generate_action_items(self, categorized: Dict, trends: Dict) -> List[Dict]:
        """Generate prioritized action items."""
        action_items = []
        
        # High priority items
        for alert in categorized['High'][:3]:  # Top 3 high-risk
            action_items.append({
                'priority': 'CRITICAL',
                'title': f"Fix: {alert.get('name', 'Unknown vulnerability')}",
                'description': alert.get('desc', '')[:200] + '...',
                'affected_urls': len(alert.get('instances', [])),
                'estimated_effort': 'High'
            })
        
        # New issues from trend analysis
        for alert in trends['new_issues'][:2]:  # Top 2 new issues
            action_items.append({
                'priority': 'HIGH',
                'title': f"Investigate new issue: {alert.get('name', 'Unknown')}",
                'description': 'New security issue detected in latest scan',
                'affected_urls': len(alert.get('instances', [])),
                'estimated_effort': 'Medium'
            })
        
        return action_items
    
    def save_results(self, output_file: str):
        """Save enhanced results to file."""
        try:
            with open(output_file, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(self.enhanced_summary, f, indent=2, default=str)
            print(f"Enhanced results saved to: {output_file}")
            return True
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error saving results: {e}")
            return False

def main():
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Enhance ZAP Action-AF results with trend analysis')
    parser.add_argument('--current', required=True, help='Current scan results JSON file')
    parser.add_argument('--baseline', help='Baseline scan results JSON file')
    parser.add_argument('--environment', required=True, help='Environment name')
    parser.add_argument('--scan-type', required=True, help='Type of scan performed')
    parser.add_argument('--output', required=True, help='Output file for enhanced results')
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    processor = ZAPAFResultsProcessor()
    
    if not processor.load_results(args.current, args.baseline):
        sys.exit(1)
    
    enhanced_results = processor.generate_enhanced_summary(args.environment, args.scan_type)
    
    if not processor.save_results(args.output):
        sys.exit(1)
    
    # Print summary to stdout for GitHub Actions
    print("\n=== Enhanced ZAP Action-AF Results Summary ===")
    print(f"Environment: {enhanced_results['metadata']['environment']}")
    print(f"Scan Type: {enhanced_results['metadata']['scan_type']}")
    print(f"Total Alerts: {enhanced_results['summary']['total_alerts']}")
    print(f"High Risk: {enhanced_results['summary']['high_risk']}")
    print(f"Medium Risk: {enhanced_results['summary']['medium_risk']}")
    print(f"New Issues: {enhanced_results['trend_analysis']['new_issues_count']}")
    print(f"Resolved Issues: {enhanced_results['trend_analysis']['resolved_issues_count']}")
    print(f"Compliance Score: {enhanced_results['compliance_status']['overall_score']}/100")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

4. Consolidated Results Processing Script​

Create .github/scripts/consolidate-zap-af-results.py:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Consolidate multiple ZAP Action-AF scan results into a unified report.
"""

import json
import os
import sys
import argparse
from datetime import datetime
from typing import Dict, List, Any
from pathlib import Path

class ZAPAFConsolidator:
    def __init__(self):
        self.scan_results = []
        self.consolidated_data = {}
        
    def load_scan_results(self, input_dir: str) -> bool:
        """Load all ZAP Action-AF scan results from directory."""
        input_path = Path(input_dir)
        
        if not input_path.exists():
            print(f"Input directory does not exist: {input_dir}")
            return False
            
        # Look for enhanced summary files
        for file_path in input_path.glob("**/enhanced-summary.json"):
            try:
                with open(file_path, 'r') as f:
                    result = json.load(f)
                    self.scan_results.append(result)
                    print(f"Loaded: {file_path}")
            except (json.JSONDecodeError, FileNotFoundError) as e:
                print(f"Error loading {file_path}: {e}")
                
        if not self.scan_results:
            print("No enhanced summary files found")
            return False
            
        return True
    
    def consolidate_results(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Consolidate all scan results into unified report."""
        self.consolidated_data = {
            'consolidation_metadata': {
                'generated_at': datetime.now().isoformat(),
                'total_scans': len(self.scan_results),
                'scan_types': list(set([r['metadata']['scan_type'] for r in self.scan_results])),
                'environments': list(set([r['metadata']['environment'] for r in self.scan_results]))
            },
            'aggregate_summary': self._calculate_aggregate_summary(),
            'environment_breakdown': self._breakdown_by_environment(),
            'scan_type_breakdown': self._breakdown_by_scan_type(),
            'trend_analysis': self._aggregate_trend_analysis(),
            'compliance_overview': self._aggregate_compliance(),
            'top_vulnerabilities': self._identify_top_vulnerabilities(),
            'recommendations': self._generate_consolidated_recommendations(),
            'executive_summary': self._generate_executive_summary()
        }
        
        return self.consolidated_data
    
    def _calculate_aggregate_summary(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
        """Calculate aggregate vulnerability counts."""
        aggregate = {
            'total_alerts': 0,
            'high_risk': 0,
            'medium_risk': 0,
            'low_risk': 0,
            'informational': 0,
            'new_issues': 0,
            'resolved_issues': 0
        }
        
        for result in self.scan_results:
            summary = result.get('summary', {})
            trends = result.get('trend_analysis', {})
            
            aggregate['total_alerts'] += summary.get('total_alerts', 0)
            aggregate['high_risk'] += summary.get('high_risk', 0)
            aggregate['medium_risk'] += summary.get('medium_risk', 0)
            aggregate['low_risk'] += summary.get('low_risk', 0)
            aggregate['informational'] += summary.get('informational', 0)
            aggregate['new_issues'] += trends.get('new_issues_count', 0)
            aggregate['resolved_issues'] += trends.get('resolved_issues_count', 0)
            
        return aggregate
    
    def _breakdown_by_environment(self) -> Dict[str, Dict]:
        """Break down results by environment."""
        breakdown = {}
        
        for result in self.scan_results:
            env = result['metadata']['environment']
            if env not in breakdown:
                breakdown[env] = {
                    'total_alerts': 0,
                    'high_risk': 0,
                    'medium_risk': 0,
                    'low_risk': 0,
                    'compliance_score': 0,
                    'scan_count': 0
                }
            
            summary = result.get('summary', {})
            compliance = result.get('compliance_status', {})
            
            breakdown[env]['total_alerts'] += summary.get('total_alerts', 0)
            breakdown[env]['high_risk'] += summary.get('high_risk', 0)
            breakdown[env]['medium_risk'] += summary.get('medium_risk', 0)
            breakdown[env]['low_risk'] += summary.get('low_risk', 0)
            breakdown[env]['compliance_score'] += compliance.get('overall_score', 0)
            breakdown[env]['scan_count'] += 1
            
        # Calculate average compliance scores
        for env_data in breakdown.values():
            if env_data['scan_count'] > 0:
                env_data['avg_compliance_score'] = env_data['compliance_score'] / env_data['scan_count']
                
        return breakdown
    
    def _breakdown_by_scan_type(self) -> Dict[str, Dict]:
        """Break down results by scan type."""
        breakdown = {}
        
        for result in self.scan_results:
            scan_type = result['metadata']['scan_type']
            if scan_type not in breakdown:
                breakdown[scan_type] = {
                    'total_scans': 0,
                    'avg_alerts': 0,
                    'avg_high_risk': 0,
                    'effectiveness_score': 0
                }
            
            summary = result.get('summary', {})
            breakdown[scan_type]['total_scans'] += 1
            breakdown[scan_type]['avg_alerts'] += summary.get('total_alerts', 0)
            breakdown[scan_type]['avg_high_risk'] += summary.get('high_risk', 0)
            
        # Calculate averages
        for scan_data in breakdown.values():
            if scan_data['total_scans'] > 0:
                scan_data['avg_alerts'] /= scan_data['total_scans']
                scan_data['avg_high_risk'] /= scan_data['total_scans']
                # Effectiveness = inverse of average high-risk findings
                scan_data['effectiveness_score'] = max(0, 100 - (scan_data['avg_high_risk'] * 10))
                
        return breakdown
    
    def _aggregate_trend_analysis(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Aggregate trend analysis across all scans."""
        trends = {
            'overall_trend': 'stable',
            'security_improvement': False,
            'critical_new_issues': [],
            'positive_changes': 0,
            'negative_changes': 0
        }
        
        total_new = 0
        total_resolved = 0
        
        for result in self.scan_results:
            trend_data = result.get('trend_analysis', {})
            total_new += trend_data.get('new_issues_count', 0)
            total_resolved += trend_data.get('resolved_issues_count', 0)
            
            # Collect critical new issues
            new_issues = trend_data.get('new_issues', [])
            for issue in new_issues:
                if 'High' in issue.get('riskdesc', ''):
                    trends['critical_new_issues'].append(issue)
        
        # Determine overall trend
        if total_resolved > total_new:
            trends['overall_trend'] = 'improving'
            trends['security_improvement'] = True
            trends['positive_changes'] = total_resolved - total_new
        elif total_new > total_resolved:
            trends['overall_trend'] = 'degrading'
            trends['negative_changes'] = total_new - total_resolved
            
        return trends
    
    def _aggregate_compliance(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Aggregate compliance information."""
        compliance = {
            'overall_score': 0,
            'owasp_compliance_rate': 0,
            'pci_compliance_rate': 0,
            'environment_scores': {},
            'compliance_trend': 'stable'
        }
        
        total_score = 0
        owasp_compliant = 0
        pci_compliant = 0
        total_scans = len(self.scan_results)
        
        for result in self.scan_results:
            compliance_data = result.get('compliance_status', {})
            env = result['metadata']['environment']
            
            score = compliance_data.get('overall_score', 0)
            total_score += score
            
            if env not in compliance['environment_scores']:
                compliance['environment_scores'][env] = []
            compliance['environment_scores'][env].append(score)
            
            # Check OWASP compliance
            owasp_data = compliance_data.get('owasp_top_10', {})
            if isinstance(owasp_data, dict) and all(owasp_data.values()):
                owasp_compliant += 1
                
            # Check PCI compliance
            if compliance_data.get('pci_dss', False):
                pci_compliant += 1
        
        if total_scans > 0:
            compliance['overall_score'] = total_score / total_scans
            compliance['owasp_compliance_rate'] = (owasp_compliant / total_scans) * 100
            compliance['pci_compliance_rate'] = (pci_compliant / total_scans) * 100
            
        return compliance
    
    def _identify_top_vulnerabilities(self) -> List[Dict]:
        """Identify the most common vulnerabilities across all scans."""
        vulnerability_counts = {}
        
        for result in self.scan_results:
            # This would require access to the detailed alert data
            # For now, we'll extract from action items
            action_items = result.get('action_items', [])
            for item in action_items:
                title = item.get('title', '')
                if title not in vulnerability_counts:
                    vulnerability_counts[title] = {
                        'count': 0,
                        'priority': item.get('priority', 'LOW'),
                        'description': item.get('description', '')
                    }
                vulnerability_counts[title]['count'] += 1
        
        # Sort by count and return top 10
        sorted_vulns = sorted(vulnerability_counts.items(), 
                            key=lambda x: x[1]['count'], reverse=True)
        
        return [{'name': name, **data} for name, data in sorted_vulns[:10]]
    
    def _generate_consolidated_recommendations(self) -> List[str]:
        """Generate consolidated recommendations."""
        recommendations = []
        aggregate = self.consolidated_data.get('aggregate_summary', {})
        trends = self.consolidated_data.get('trend_analysis', {})
        compliance = self.consolidated_data.get('compliance_overview', {})
        
        # High-level recommendations based on aggregate data
        if aggregate.get('high_risk', 0) > 0:
            recommendations.append(f"Critical: Address {aggregate['high_risk']} high-risk vulnerabilities across all environments")
            
        if trends.get('overall_trend') == 'degrading':
            recommendations.append("Security posture is declining - review security processes and implement additional controls")
            
        if compliance.get('overall_score', 0) < 80:
            recommendations.append("Compliance score below acceptable threshold - prioritize remediation efforts")
            
        # Environment-specific recommendations
        env_breakdown = self.consolidated_data.get('environment_breakdown', {})
        for env, data in env_breakdown.items():
            if data.get('high_risk', 0) > 5:
                recommendations.append(f"Focus remediation efforts on {env} environment ({data['high_risk']} high-risk issues)")
                
        return recommendations[:10]  # Top 10 recommendations
    
    def _generate_executive_summary(self) -> str:
        """Generate executive summary text."""
        aggregate = self.consolidated_data.get('aggregate_summary', {})
        trends = self.consolidated_data.get('trend_analysis', {})
        compliance = self.consolidated_data.get('compliance_overview', {})
        
        summary = f"""
## Executive Security Summary

**Security Posture Overview:**
- Total vulnerabilities identified: {aggregate.get('total_alerts', 0)}
- Critical/High-risk issues: {aggregate.get('high_risk', 0)}
- Security trend: {trends.get('overall_trend', 'stable').title()}
- Overall compliance score: {compliance.get('overall_score', 0):.1f}/100

**Key Findings:**
- {len(self.consolidated_data.get('top_vulnerabilities', []))} unique vulnerability types identified
- {aggregate.get('new_issues', 0)} new security issues detected
- {aggregate.get('resolved_issues', 0)} previous issues resolved
- {compliance.get('owasp_compliance_rate', 0):.1f}% OWASP Top 10 compliance rate

**Risk Assessment:**
{'🔴 HIGH RISK' if aggregate.get('high_risk', 0) > 0 else '🟡 MEDIUM RISK' if aggregate.get('medium_risk', 0) > 10 else '🟢 LOW RISK'}

**Action Required:**
{len(self.consolidated_data.get('recommendations', []))} immediate recommendations for security improvement.
        """.strip()
        
        return summary
    
    def generate_html_report(self, output_file: str) -> bool:
        """Generate comprehensive HTML report."""
        html_template = """
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Consolidated ZAP Action-AF Security Report</title>
    <style>
        body { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; margin: 20px; line-height: 1.6; }
        .header { background: #2c3e50; color: white; padding: 20px; border-radius: 5px; }
        .summary-grid { display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(250px, 1fr)); gap: 20px; margin: 20px 0; }
        .metric-card { background: #f8f9fa; padding: 15px; border-radius: 5px; border-left: 4px solid #007bff; }
        .high-risk { border-left-color: #dc3545 !important; background: #f8d7da; }
        .medium-risk { border-left-color: #ffc107 !important; background: #fff3cd; }
        .low-risk { border-left-color: #28a745 !important; background: #d4edda; }
        .table { width: 100%; border-collapse: collapse; margin: 20px 0; }
        .table th, .table td { padding: 12px; text-align: left; border-bottom: 1px solid #ddd; }
        .table th { background: #f8f9fa; font-weight: bold; }
        .recommendations { background: #e9ecef; padding: 20px; border-radius: 5px; margin: 20px 0; }
        .chart-container { margin: 20px 0; }
        .executive-summary { background: #f1f3f4; padding: 20px; border-radius: 5px; margin: 20px 0; }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <div class="header">
        <h1>🔒 Consolidated ZAP Action-AF Security Report</h1>
        <p>Generated on: {generated_at}</p>
        <p>Total Scans Analyzed: {total_scans}</p>
    </div>
    
    <div class="executive-summary">
        <h2>Executive Summary</h2>
        <pre>{executive_summary}</pre>
    </div>
    
    <div class="summary-grid">
        <div class="metric-card high-risk">
            <h3>🚨 High Risk</h3>
            <div style="font-size: 2em; font-weight: bold;">{high_risk}</div>
            <p>Critical vulnerabilities requiring immediate attention</p>
        </div>
        <div class="metric-card medium-risk">
            <h3>⚠️ Medium Risk</h3>
            <div style="font-size: 2em; font-weight: bold;">{medium_risk}</div>
            <p>Important security issues to address</p>
        </div>
        <div class="metric-card low-risk">
            <h3>ℹ️ Low Risk</h3>
            <div style="font-size: 2em; font-weight: bold;">{low_risk}</div>
            <p>Minor issues and informational findings</p>
        </div>
        <div class="metric-card">
            <h3>📊 Compliance Score</h3>
            <div style="font-size: 2em; font-weight: bold;">{compliance_score:.1f}/100</div>
            <p>Overall security compliance rating</p>
        </div>
    </div>
    
    <h2>Environment Breakdown</h2>
    <table class="table">
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th>Environment</th>
                <th>Total Alerts</th>
                <th>High Risk</th>
                <th>Medium Risk</th>
                <th>Compliance Score</th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            {environment_rows}
        </tbody>
    </table>
    
    <h2>Top Vulnerabilities</h2>
    <table class="table">
        <thead>
            <tr>
                <th>Vulnerability</th>
                <th>Occurrences</th>
                <th>Priority</th>
                <th>Description</th>
            </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>
            {vulnerability_rows}
        </tbody>
    </table>
    
    <div class="recommendations">
        <h2>📋 Recommendations</h2>
        <ol>
            {recommendation_items}
        </ol>
    </div>
    
    <h2>Detailed Data</h2>
    <pre style="background: #f8f9fa; padding: 20px; border-radius: 5px; overflow-x: auto;">{json_data}</pre>
</body>
</html>
        """
        
        # Prepare template data
        aggregate = self.consolidated_data.get('aggregate_summary', {})
        compliance = self.consolidated_data.get('compliance_overview', {})
        env_breakdown = self.consolidated_data.get('environment_breakdown', {})
        top_vulns = self.consolidated_data.get('top_vulnerabilities', [])
        recommendations = self.consolidated_data.get('recommendations', [])
        
        # Generate environment rows
        env_rows = ""
        for env, data in env_breakdown.items():
            env_rows += f"""
            <tr>
                <td>{env}</td>
                <td>{data.get('total_alerts', 0)}</td>
                <td>{data.get('high_risk', 0)}</td>
                <td>{data.get('medium_risk', 0)}</td>
                <td>{data.get('avg_compliance_score', 0):.1f}</td>
            </tr>
            """
        
        # Generate vulnerability rows
        vuln_rows = ""
        for vuln in top_vulns[:10]:
            vuln_rows += f"""
            <tr>
                <td>{vuln.get('name', 'Unknown')}</td>
                <td>{vuln.get('count', 0)}</td>
                <td>{vuln.get('priority', 'LOW')}</td>
                <td>{vuln.get('description', 'No description available')[:100]}...</td>
            </tr>
            """
        
        # Generate recommendation items
        rec_items = ""
        for i, rec in enumerate(recommendations[:10], 1):
            rec_items += f"<li>{rec}</li>"
        
        # Fill template
        html_content = html_template.format(
            generated_at=self.consolidated_data['consolidation_metadata']['generated_at'],
            total_scans=self.consolidated_data['consolidation_metadata']['total_scans'],
            executive_summary=self.consolidated_data.get('executive_summary', ''),
            high_risk=aggregate.get('high_risk', 0),
            medium_risk=aggregate.get('medium_risk', 0),
            low_risk=aggregate.get('low_risk', 0),
            compliance_score=compliance.get('overall_score', 0),
            environment_rows=env_rows,
            vulnerability_rows=vuln_rows,
            recommendation_items=rec_items,
            json_data=json.dumps(self.consolidated_data, indent=2)
        )
        
        try:
            with open(output_file, 'w') as f:
                f.write(html_content)
            print(f"HTML report generated: {output_file}")
            return True
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error generating HTML report: {e}")
            return False
    
    def save_json_results(self, output_file: str) -> bool:
        """Save consolidated results as JSON."""
        try:
            with open(output_file, 'w') as f:
                json.dump(self.consolidated_data, f, indent=2, default=str)
            print(f"JSON results saved: {output_file}")
            return True
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error saving JSON results: {e}")
            return False

def main():
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='Consolidate ZAP Action-AF scan results')
    parser.add_argument('--input-dir', required=True, help='Directory containing scan results')
    parser.add_argument('--output', required=True, help='Output HTML report file')
    parser.add_argument('--json-output', help='Output JSON results file')
    
    args = parser.parse_args()
    
    consolidator = ZAPAFConsolidator()
    
    if not consolidator.load_scan_results(args.input_dir):
        sys.exit(1)
    
    consolidated_results = consolidator.consolidate_results()
    
    if not consolidator.generate_html_report(args.output):
        sys.exit(1)
    
    if args.json_output:
        if not consolidator.save_json_results(args.json_output):
            sys.exit(1)
    
    # Print summary
    print(f"\n=== Consolidation Complete ===")
    print(f"Processed {len(consolidator.scan_results)} scan results")
    print(f"Total vulnerabilities: {consolidated_results['aggregate_summary']['total_alerts']}")
    print(f"High-risk issues: {consolidated_results['aggregate_summary']['high_risk']}")
    print(f"Overall compliance score: {consolidated_results['compliance_overview']['overall_score']:.1f}/100")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

Docker Integration​

1. Custom ZAP Container​

FROM owasp/zap2docker-stable

# Install additional dependencies
USER root
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
    python3-pip \
    jq \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

RUN pip3 install requests beautifulsoup4 lxml

2. ZAP Configuration Script​

Create docker/zap/scripts/configure-zap.py:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Configure ZAP for automated scanning.
"""

import requests
import time
import sys
import json

class ZAPConfigurer:
    def __init__(self, zap_url='http://localhost:8080'):
        self.zap_url = zap_url
        self.api_key = None
        
    def wait_for_zap(self, timeout=60):
        """Wait for ZAP to start up."""
        start_time = time.time()
        while time.time() - start_time < timeout:
            try:
                response = requests.get(f'{self.zap_url}/JSON/core/view/version/')
                if response.status_code == 200:
                    print("ZAP is ready")
                    return True
            except requests.ConnectionError:
                print("Waiting for ZAP to start...")
                time.sleep(2)
        
        print("Timeout waiting for ZAP to start")
        return False
    
    def configure_api_key(self):
        """Configure API key for ZAP."""
        try:
            # Generate API key
            response = requests.get(f'{self.zap_url}/JSON/core/action/generateApiKey/')
            if response.status_code == 200:
                self.api_key = response.json()['Result']
                print(f"API key configured: {self.api_key}")
                return True
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error configuring API key: {e}")
        return False
    
    def configure_scanner_settings(self):
        """Configure scanner settings."""
        settings = {
            'scanner.maxResultsToList': '100',
            'scanner.maxRuleDurationInMins': '5',
            'scanner.maxScanDurationInMins': '60',
            'scanner.threadPerHost': '2'
        }
        
        for key, value in settings.items():
            try:
                params = {
                    'apikey': self.api_key,
                    'key': key,
                    'value': value
                }
                response = requests.get(f'{self.zap_url}/JSON/core/action/setOptionValue/', params=params)
                if response.status_code == 200:
                    print(f"Set {key} = {value}")
            except Exception as e:
                print(f"Error setting {key}: {e}")
    
    def configure_passive_rules(self):
        """Enable/disable passive scan rules."""
        # Enable important passive rules
        important_rules = [
            '10015',  # Incomplete or No Cache-control and Pragma HTTP Header Set
            '10020',  # X-Frame-Options Header Not Set
            '10021',  # X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing
            '10035',  # Strict-Transport-Security Header Not Set
            '10038',  # Content Security Policy (CSP) Header Not Set
        ]
        
        for rule_id in important_rules:
            try:
                params = {
                    'apikey': self.api_key,
                    'ids': rule_id
                }
                response = requests.get(f'{self.zap_url}/JSON/pscan/action/enableScanners/', params=params)
                if response.status_code == 200:
                    print(f"Enabled passive rule: {rule_id}")
            except Exception as e:
                print(f"Error enabling rule {rule_id}: {e}")

def main():
    configurator = ZAPConfigurer()
    
    if not configurator.wait_for_zap():
        sys.exit(1)
    
    if not configurator.configure_api_key():
        sys.exit(1)
    
    configurator.configure_scanner_settings()
    configurator.configure_passive_rules()
    
    print("ZAP configuration completed successfully")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

Advanced Configurations​

1. Multi-Application Pipeline​

Create .github/workflows/multi-app-dast.yml:

name: Multi-Application DAST

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 4 * * 1-5'  # Weekdays at 4 AM

env:
  APPLICATIONS: |
    {
      "frontend": {
        "url": "https://app.example.com",
        "auth_required": false,
        "scan_type": "baseline"
      },
      "api": {
        "url": "https://api.example.com",
        "auth_required": true,
        "scan_type": "api",
        "openapi_url": "https://api.example.com/docs/json"
      },
      "admin": {
        "url": "https://admin.example.com",
        "auth_required": true,
        "scan_type": "full"
      }
    }

jobs:
  matrix-setup:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      matrix: ${{ steps.set-matrix.outputs.matrix }}
    
    steps:
    - id: set-matrix
      run: |
        echo "matrix=$(echo '${{ env.APPLICATIONS }}' | jq -c 'to_entries | map({app: .key, config: .value})')" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

  dast-scan:
    needs: matrix-setup
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        include: ${{ fromJson(needs.matrix-setup.outputs.matrix) }}
      fail-fast: false
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Setup authentication
      if: matrix.config.auth_required
      run: |
        # Setup authentication context for the application
        echo "Setting up auth for ${{ matrix.app }}"
        
    - name: Run DAST scan
      run: |
        case "${{ matrix.config.scan_type }}" in
          "baseline")
            docker run --rm \
              -v $(pwd)/reports:/zap/reports \
              owasp/zap2docker-stable \
              zap-baseline.py -t ${{ matrix.config.url }} \
              -J /zap/reports/${{ matrix.app }}-baseline.json \
              -H /zap/reports/${{ matrix.app }}-baseline.html
            ;;
          "api")
            curl -o openapi.json ${{ matrix.config.openapi_url }}
            docker run --rm \
              -v $(pwd)/openapi.json:/zap/openapi.json \
              -v $(pwd)/reports:/zap/reports \
              owasp/zap2docker-stable \
              zap-api-scan.py -t ${{ matrix.config.url }} \
              -f openapi -d /zap/openapi.json \
              -J /zap/reports/${{ matrix.app }}-api.json \
              -H /zap/reports/${{ matrix.app }}-api.html
            ;;
          "full")
            docker run --rm \
              -v $(pwd)/reports:/zap/reports \
              owasp/zap2docker-stable \
              zap-full-scan.py -t ${{ matrix.config.url }} \
              -J /zap/reports/${{ matrix.app }}-full.json \
              -H /zap/reports/${{ matrix.app }}-full.html
            ;;
        esac
        
    - name: Upload scan results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      if: always()
      with:
        name: ${{ matrix.app }}-dast-results
        path: reports/
