Reporting and Integration​

1. Slack Notification​

Create .github/scripts/slack-notification.py:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Send DAST results to Slack.
"""

import json
import requests
import sys
import os

def send_slack_notification(webhook_url, scan_results):
    """Send scan results to Slack."""
    
    # Determine color based on results
    if scan_results['high_risk'] > 0:
        color = "danger"
        status = "🚨 HIGH RISK"
    elif scan_results['medium_risk'] > 0:
        color = "warning"
        status = "⚠️ MEDIUM RISK"
    elif scan_results['low_risk'] > 0:
        color = "good"
        status = "ℹ️ LOW RISK"
    else:
        color = "good"
        status = "✅ SECURE"
    
    # Build Slack message
    message = {
        "attachments": [
            {
                "color": color,
                "title": f"DAST Security Scan Complete - {status}",
                "fields": [
                    {
                        "title": "Repository",
                        "value": os.environ.get('GITHUB_REPOSITORY', 'Unknown'),
                        "short": True
                    },
                    {
                        "title": "Branch",
                        "value": os.environ.get('GITHUB_REF_NAME', 'Unknown'),
                        "short": True
                    },
                    {
                        "title": "High Risk",
                        "value": str(scan_results['high_risk']),
                        "short": True
                    },
                    {
                        "title": "Medium Risk",
                        "value": str(scan_results['medium_risk']),
                        "short": True
                    },
                    {
                        "title": "Low Risk",
                        "value": str(scan_results['low_risk']),
                        "short": True
                    },
                    {
                        "title": "Total Issues",
                        "value": str(scan_results['total_vulnerabilities']),
                        "short": True
                    }
                ],
                "footer": "OWASP ZAP DAST Scanner",
                "ts": int(time.time())
            }
        ]
    }
    
    # Add action buttons if there are issues
    if scan_results['total_vulnerabilities'] > 0:
        message["attachments"][0]["actions"] = [
            {
                "type": "button",
                "text": "View Details",
                "url": f"https://github.com/{os.environ.get('GITHUB_REPOSITORY')}/actions/runs/{os.environ.get('GITHUB_RUN_ID')}"
            }
        ]
    
    # Send to Slack
    response = requests.post(webhook_url, json=message)
    
    if response.status_code == 200:
        print("Slack notification sent successfully")
        return True
    else:
        print(f"Failed to send Slack notification: {response.status_code}")
        return False

def main():
    if len(sys.argv) != 3:
        print("Usage: python3 slack-notification.py <webhook_url> <results.json>")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    webhook_url = sys.argv[1]
    results_file = sys.argv[2]
    
    try:
        with open(results_file, 'r') as f:
            results = json.load(f)
    except FileNotFoundError:
        print(f"Results file not found: {results_file}")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    send_slack_notification(webhook_url, results)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import time
    main()

2. JIRA Integration​

Create .github/scripts/jira-integration.py:

#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""
Create JIRA tickets for security vulnerabilities.
"""

import json
import requests
import sys
import os
from base64 import b64encode

class JiraIntegration:
    def __init__(self, server, username, api_token):
        self.server = server
        self.auth = b64encode(f"{username}:{api_token}".encode()).decode()
        self.headers = {
            'Authorization': f'Basic {self.auth}',
            'Content-Type': 'application/json'
        }
    
    def create_security_ticket(self, vulnerability):
        """Create a JIRA ticket for a security vulnerability."""
        
        # Map ZAP risk levels to JIRA priorities
        priority_map = {
            'High': 'Highest',
            'Medium': 'High',
            'Low': 'Medium',
            'Informational': 'Low'
        }
        
        ticket_data = {
            "fields": {
                "project": {"key": "SEC"},
                "summary": f"[DAST] {vulnerability['name']}",
                "description": {
                    "type": "doc",
                    "version": 1,
                    "content": [
                        {
                            "type": "paragraph",
                            "content": [
                                {
                                    "type": "text",
                                    "text": f"Security vulnerability detected by DAST scan:\n\n"
                                }
                            ]
                        },
                        {
                            "type": "paragraph",
                            "content": [
                                {
                                    "type": "text",
                                    "text": f"Risk Level: {vulnerability['risk']}\n"
                                },
                                {
                                    "type": "text",
                                    "text": f"Confidence: {vulnerability['confidence']}\n"
                                },
                                {
                                    "type": "text",
                                    "text": f"Instances: {vulnerability['instances']}\n\n"
                                }
                            ]
                        },
                        {
                            "type": "heading",
                            "attrs": {"level": 3},
                            "content": [
                                {
                                    "type": "text",
                                    "text": "Description"
                                }
                            ]
                        },
                        {
                            "type": "paragraph",
                            "content": [
                                {
                                    "type": "text",
                                    "text": vulnerability['description']
                                }
                            ]
                        },
                        {
                            "type": "heading",
                            "attrs": {"level": 3},
                            "content": [
                                {
                                    "type": "text",
                                    "text": "Recommended Solution"
                                }
                            ]
                        },
                        {
                            "type": "paragraph",
                            "content": [
                                {
                                    "type": "text",
                                    "text": vulnerability['solution']
                                }
                            ]
                        }
                    ]
                },
                "issuetype": {"name": "Bug"},
                "priority": {"name": priority_map.get(vulnerability['risk'], 'Medium')},
                "labels": ["security", "dast", "vulnerability", vulnerability['risk'].lower()],
                "components": [{"name": "Security"}]
            }
        }
        
        response = requests.post(
            f"{self.server}/rest/api/3/issue",
            headers=self.headers,
            json=ticket_data
        )
        
        if response.status_code == 201:
            ticket = response.json()
            print(f"Created JIRA ticket: {ticket['key']}")
            return ticket['key']
        else:
            print(f"Failed to create JIRA ticket: {response.status_code}")
            print(response.text)
            return None

def main():
    if len(sys.argv) != 2:
        print("Usage: python3 jira-integration.py <vulnerabilities.json>")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    # Get JIRA credentials from environment
    server = os.environ.get('JIRA_SERVER')
    username = os.environ.get('JIRA_USERNAME')
    api_token = os.environ.get('JIRA_API_TOKEN')
    
    if not all([server, username, api_token]):
        print("Missing JIRA credentials in environment variables")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    # Load vulnerabilities
    vulns_file = sys.argv[1]
    try:
        with open(vulns_file, 'r') as f:
            vulnerabilities = json.load(f)
    except FileNotFoundError:
        print(f"Vulnerabilities file not found: {vulns_file}")
        sys.exit(1)
    
    # Create JIRA integration
    jira = JiraIntegration(server, username, api_token)
    
    # Create tickets for high and medium risk vulnerabilities
    for vuln in vulnerabilities:
        if vuln['risk'] in ['High', 'Medium']:
            jira.create_security_ticket(vuln)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

Action-AF Advanced Features and Best Practices​

Action-AF Unique Capabilities​

The zaproxy/action-af@v0.2.0 action extends standard ZAP functionality with several advanced features designed for enterprise CI/CD environments:

1. Intelligent Vulnerability Filtering​

Action-AF implements sophisticated filtering algorithms that go beyond simple rule-based exclusions:

# Advanced filtering configuration
filter_config:
  intelligence_level: "adaptive"  # Options: basic, standard, adaptive, ml-enhanced
  learning_mode: true             # Learns from manual reviews
  confidence_weighting: true      # Adjusts findings based on confidence levels
  context_awareness: true         # Considers application context for filtering

Key Features:

  • Machine Learning Integration: Uses ML models to predict false positives
  • Context-Aware Filtering: Understands application architecture for better filtering
  • Adaptive Learning: Improves filtering accuracy over time based on feedback
  • Historical Analysis: Compares against previous scans for trend detection

3. Dynamic Configuration Management​

Use dynamic configuration based on environment and application characteristics:

- name: Configure Action-AF based on application type
  id: configure-scan
  run: |
    # Detect application type
    if [ -f "package.json" ]; then
      APP_TYPE="nodejs"
    elif [ -f "requirements.txt" ]; then
      APP_TYPE="python"
    elif [ -f "pom.xml" ]; then
      APP_TYPE="java"
    else
      APP_TYPE="generic"
    fi
    
    # Set configuration based on app type
    case $APP_TYPE in
      nodejs)
        echo "RULES_FILE=.zap/rules/nodejs-af.json" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        echo "SCAN_TIMEOUT=20" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        ;;
      python)
        echo "RULES_FILE=.zap/rules/python-af.json" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        echo "SCAN_TIMEOUT=25" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        ;;
      java)
        echo "RULES_FILE=.zap/rules/java-af.json" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        echo "SCAN_TIMEOUT=35" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        ;;
      *)
        echo "RULES_FILE=.zap/rules/generic-af.json" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        echo "SCAN_TIMEOUT=15" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        ;;
    esac

- name: ZAP Action-AF with Dynamic Configuration
  uses: zaproxy/action-af@v0.2.0
  with:
    target: ${{ env.TARGET_URL }}
    scan_type: 'full'
    rules_file_name: ${{ env.RULES_FILE }}
    cmd_options: '-a -j -T ${{ env.SCAN_TIMEOUT }}'

Advanced Monitoring and Alerting​

1. Real-time Security Dashboard Integration​

Create real-time dashboards that integrate with Action-AF results:

# Dashboard integration example
class SecurityDashboard:
    def __init__(self, dashboard_url, api_key):
        self.dashboard_url = dashboard_url
        self.api_key = api_key
        
    def update_security_metrics(self, scan_results):
        """Update dashboard with latest scan results."""
        metrics = {
            'timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(),
            'environment': scan_results['metadata']['environment'],
            'total_vulnerabilities': scan_results['summary']['total_alerts'],
            'high_risk_count': scan_results['summary']['high_risk'],
            'compliance_score': scan_results['compliance_status']['overall_score'],
            'trend_direction': self._calculate_trend(scan_results),
            'new_issues': scan_results['trend_analysis']['new_issues_count'],
            'resolved_issues': scan_results['trend_analysis']['resolved_issues_count']
        }
        
        # Send to dashboard API
        self._post_metrics(metrics)
    
    def _calculate_trend(self, results):
        """Calculate security trend direction."""
        new_count = results['trend_analysis']['new_issues_count']
        resolved_count = results['trend_analysis']['resolved_issues_count']
        
        if resolved_count > new_count:
            return 'improving'
        elif new_count > resolved_count:
            return 'degrading'
        else:
            return 'stable'

Compliance and Governance​

1. Automated Compliance Reporting​

Generate automated compliance reports for various standards:

class ComplianceReporter:
    def __init__(self):
        self.compliance_frameworks = {
            'owasp_top_10': OWASP_TOP_10_MAPPING,
            'pci_dss': PCI_DSS_MAPPING,
            'nist_csf': NIST_CSF_MAPPING,
            'iso_27001': ISO_27001_MAPPING
        }
    
    def generate_compliance_report(self, scan_results, framework):
        """Generate compliance report for specific framework."""
        framework_mapping = self.compliance_frameworks.get(framework)
        if not framework_mapping:
            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported framework: {framework}")
        
        alerts = self._extract_alerts(scan_results)
        compliance_status = {}
        
        for control_id, control_mapping in framework_mapping.items():
            relevant_alerts = self._filter_alerts_by_control(alerts, control_mapping)
            compliance_status[control_id] = {
                'status': 'compliant' if not relevant_alerts else 'non_compliant',
                'violations': len(relevant_alerts),
                'risk_level': self._assess_control_risk(relevant_alerts),
                'remediation_priority': self._calculate_priority(relevant_alerts)
            }
        
        return compliance_status

2. Security Policy Enforcement​

Implement automated security policy enforcement:

# Security policy configuration
security_policies:
  zero_tolerance:
    - rule_ids: ["10001", "10002", "10003"]  # SQL Injection variants
      action: "block_deployment"
      notification: "security_team"
      
  conditional_tolerance:
    - rule_ids: ["10020", "10021"]  # Missing security headers
      conditions:
        - environment: "development"
          action: "warn"
        - environment: "production"
          action: "block_deployment"
          
  acceptable_risk:
    - rule_ids: ["10049", "10050"]  # Cache-related findings
      conditions:
        - max_instances: 5
          action: "warn"
        - max_instances: 10
          action: "block_deployment"

Team Collaboration Features​

1. Multi-Team Workflow Integration​

Configure Action-AF for multi-team environments:

# Multi-team configuration
team_responsibilities:
  security_team:
    notifications:
      - high_risk_findings
      - policy_violations
      - compliance_failures
    approvals_required:
      - policy_exceptions
      - risk_acceptance
      
  development_team:
    notifications:
      - scan_failures
      - new_medium_risk_findings
    self_service:
      - false_positive_marking
      - exception_requests
      
  devops_team:
    notifications:
      - scan_infrastructure_issues
      - performance_degradation
    responsibilities:
      - scan_configuration
      - infrastructure_maintenance

2. Knowledge Base Integration​

Integrate with organizational knowledge bases:

class SecurityKnowledgeBase:
    def __init__(self, kb_api_url, api_key):
        self.kb_api_url = kb_api_url
        self.api_key = api_key
    
    def enrich_findings(self, scan_results):
        """Enrich scan findings with organizational knowledge."""
        enriched_results = scan_results.copy()
        
        for alert in enriched_results.get('alerts', []):
            # Look up internal remediation guidance
            remediation = self._get_internal_remediation(alert['pluginid'])
            if remediation:
                alert['internal_guidance'] = remediation
            
            # Check for known exceptions
            exceptions = self._check_approved_exceptions(alert)
            if exceptions:
                alert['approved_exceptions'] = exceptions
            
            # Add historical context
            history = self._get_vulnerability_history(alert)
            if history:
                alert['historical_context'] = history
        
        return enriched_results

Best Practices​

1. Scanning Strategy​

  • Pull Request Scans: Run baseline scans on PRs for quick feedback
  • Main Branch Scans: Run full scans on main branch commits
  • Scheduled Scans: Run comprehensive scans on a schedule
  • Environment-Specific: Scan staging environments before production

2. Performance Optimization​

  • Parallel Scanning: Use matrix builds for multiple applications
  • Incremental Scanning: Focus on changed components
  • Caching: Cache ZAP Docker images and results
  • Resource Limits: Set appropriate timeouts and resource limits

3. Security Considerations​

  • Credential Management: Use GitHub Secrets for sensitive data
  • Network Isolation: Run scans in isolated environments
  • Data Privacy: Avoid scanning production data
  • Access Control: Limit who can modify security configurations

4. Result Management​

  • Threshold Setting: Define acceptable risk levels
  • False Positive Management: Maintain exclusion lists
  • Trend Analysis: Track security improvements over time
  • Integration: Connect with bug tracking and notification systems

Troubleshooting​

Common Issues​

  1. ZAP Timeout Errors

    # Increase timeout values
    cmd_options: '-T 60 -z "-config spider.maxDuration=10"'

  2. Authentication Issues

    # Verify authentication context
    docker run --rm owasp/zap2docker-stable zap-cli --help

  3. False Positives

    # Add to rules file
    10054	IGNORE	Cookie Without SameSite Attribute

  4. Memory Issues

    # Increase container resources
    resources:
      requests:
        memory: "2Gi"
      limits:
        memory: "4Gi"

Action-AF Specific Troubleshooting​

1. Filter Configuration Issues​

Problem: Action-AF filters not working as expected

# Debug filter configuration
- name: Debug Action-AF Filters
  run: |
    # Validate filter file syntax
    python3 -m json.tool .zap/filters/baseline-filters.json
    
    # Check filter application logs
    grep -i "filter" zap-af-debug.log
    
    # Test individual filter rules
    python3 .github/scripts/test-filters.py \
      --filter-file .zap/filters/baseline-filters.json \
      --test-alert sample-alert.json

Solution: Verify filter file syntax and rule precedence

{
  "debug_mode": true,
  "filter_logging": "verbose",
  "validation": {
    "strict_mode": true,
    "schema_version": "1.0"
  }
}

2. Performance Degradation​

Problem: Action-AF scans running slower than expected

# Performance monitoring
- name: Monitor Action-AF Performance
  run: |
    # Check resource usage
    docker stats zap-af-container &
    
    # Monitor scan progress
    tail -f zap-af-scan.log | grep -E "(progress|performance|timing)"
    
    # Analyze bottlenecks
    python3 .github/scripts/analyze-performance.py \
      --scan-log zap-af-scan.log \
      --output performance-report.json

Solution: Optimize scan configuration

performance_optimization:
  parallel_scanning: true
  request_batching: true
  intelligent_crawling: true
  resource_limits:
    max_memory: "4G"
    max_cpu: "2"
    scan_timeout: "45m"

3. Authentication Context Issues​

Problem: Action-AF not properly handling authentication

# Debug authentication
curl -v -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" $TARGET_URL/api/protected
echo "Auth header test: $?"

# Check Action-AF auth configuration
cat .zap/auth/auth-config.json | jq '.authentication'

Solution: Configure proper authentication context

{
  "authentication": {
    "method": "bearer_token",
    "auto_detect": true,
    "validation": {
      "success_indicators": ["user", "dashboard", "profile"],
      "failure_indicators": ["login", "unauthorized", "forbidden"]
    },
    "session_management": {
      "cookie_handling": "automatic",
      "token_refresh": true,
      "timeout_detection": true
    }
  }
}

4. Integration Failures​

Problem: Action-AF failing to integrate with external tools

# Debug integration issues
- name: Test Integrations
  run: |
    # Test DefectDojo integration
    curl -X GET "$DEFECTDOJO_URL/api/v2/products/" \
      -H "Authorization: Token $DEFECTDOJO_API_KEY"
    
    # Test Jira integration  
    curl -X GET "$JIRA_URL/rest/api/2/myself" \
      -u "$JIRA_USERNAME:$JIRA_API_TOKEN"
    
    # Test Slack integration
    curl -X POST "$SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL" \
      -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
      -d '{"text": "Integration test"}'

Solution: Verify credentials and network connectivity

integration_debugging:
  retry_policy:
    max_attempts: 3
    backoff_factor: 2
    timeout: 30
  error_handling:
    log_level: "debug"
    capture_responses: true
    validate_certificates: false  # Only for testing

5. Custom Rules Not Applied​

Problem: Custom security rules not being applied

# Validate custom rules
def validate_custom_rules(rules_file):
    with open(rules_file, 'r') as f:
        rules = json.load(f)
    
    for rule in rules.get('custom_rules', []):
        # Validate rule syntax
        pattern = rule.get('pattern')
        try:
            re.compile(pattern)
            print(f"✓ Rule {rule['rule_id']}: Pattern valid")
        except re.error as e:
            print(f"✗ Rule {rule['rule_id']}: Pattern invalid - {e}")
    
    return True

Solution: Debug rule application

- name: Debug Custom Rules
  run: |
    # Test rule patterns
    python3 .github/scripts/validate-rules.py \
      --rules-file .zap/rules/baseline-af.json
    
    # Check rule loading in Action-AF
    grep -i "custom rule" zap-af-debug.log
    
    # Validate rule precedence
    python3 .github/scripts/test-rule-precedence.py

Action-AF Advanced Configuration Examples​

Enterprise Security Configuration​

Complete enterprise-grade configuration example:

# .github/workflows/enterprise-zap-af.yml
name: Enterprise ZAP Action-AF Security Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [main, release/*]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 2 * * *'  # Daily at 2 AM

env:
  ENTERPRISE_CONFIG: true
  COMPLIANCE_MODE: strict
  SECURITY_BASELINE: enterprise-v2.1

jobs:
  enterprise-security-scan:
    runs-on: [self-hosted, security-enhanced]
    strategy:
      matrix:
        environment: [staging, production]
        scan_profile: [compliance, penetration, api-security]
      fail-fast: false
      
    name: Enterprise Scan - ${{ matrix.environment }} - ${{ matrix.scan_profile }}
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout with security verification
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0
        token: ${{ secrets.ENTERPRISE_GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        
    - name: Security environment setup
      run: |
        # Load enterprise security configuration
        source .github/config/enterprise-security.env
        
        # Verify security tools
        .github/scripts/verify-security-tools.sh
        
        # Setup compliance monitoring
        .github/scripts/setup-compliance-monitoring.sh
        
    - name: Enterprise ZAP Action-AF Scan
      uses: zaproxy/action-af@v0.2.0
      with:
        target: ${{ secrets[format('{0}_URL', matrix.environment)] }}
        scan_type: ${{ matrix.scan_profile }}
        rules_file_name: '.zap/enterprise/rules/${{ matrix.scan_profile }}-enterprise.json'
        filter_file_name: '.zap/enterprise/filters/${{ matrix.environment }}-enterprise.json'
        baseline_file_name: 'enterprise-baselines/${{ matrix.environment }}-baseline.json'
        compliance_framework: 'enterprise-multi'
        threat_model: '.zap/enterprise/threat-models/${{ matrix.environment }}.json'
        cmd_options: >-
          -a -j -T 120
          -z "-config spider.maxDuration=60
              -config scanner.maxScanDurationInMins=120
              -config api.addrs.addr.name=.*
              -config api.addrs.addr.regex=true
              -config scanner.threadPerHost=5
              -config connection.timeoutInSecs=60"
        auth_header_name: 'Authorization'
        auth_header_value: 'Bearer ${{ secrets[format('{0}_AUTH_TOKEN', matrix.environment)] }}'
        fail_action: ${{ matrix.environment == 'production' && 'error' || 'warn' }}
        allow_issue_writing: true
        issue_title: 'Enterprise Security Issues - ${{ matrix.scan_profile }} - ${{ matrix.environment }}'
        issue_labels: 'security,enterprise,${{ matrix.scan_profile }},${{ matrix.environment }},compliance'
        enterprise_mode: true
        sla_enforcement: true
        automatic_remediation: false
        
    - name: Enterprise compliance validation
      run: |
        # Validate against enterprise security standards
        python3 .github/scripts/enterprise-compliance-check.py \
          --scan-results report_json.json \
          --compliance-frameworks "sox,pci-dss,iso27001,nist-csf" \
          --enterprise-policies .zap/enterprise/policies/ \
          --environment ${{ matrix.environment }}
          
    - name: Advanced threat intelligence integration
      run: |
        # Integrate with threat intelligence feeds
        python3 .github/scripts/threat-intelligence-correlation.py \
          --findings report_json.json \
          --threat-feeds ${{ secrets.THREAT_INTEL_FEEDS }} \
          --output threat-enhanced-report.json
          
    - name: Enterprise reporting and notifications
      run: |
        # Generate executive summary
        python3 .github/scripts/executive-summary.py \
          --scan-results threat-enhanced-report.json \
          --template .github/templates/executive-summary.html \
          --output executive-summary-${{ matrix.environment }}-${{ matrix.scan_profile }}.html
          
        # Send to enterprise security dashboard
        curl -X POST "${{ secrets.ENTERPRISE_SECURITY_DASHBOARD }}/api/scans" \
          -H "Authorization: Bearer ${{ secrets.DASHBOARD_API_TOKEN }}" \
          -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
          -d @threat-enhanced-report.json
          
        # Notify C-level executives for production high-risk findings
        if [[ "${{ matrix.environment }}" == "production" && $(jq '.summary.high_risk' threat-enhanced-report.json) -gt 0 ]]; then
          python3 .github/scripts/executive-notification.py \
            --severity critical \
            --environment production \
            --findings threat-enhanced-report.json
        fi

Custom Action-AF Extension​

Example of extending Action-AF functionality:

# .github/scripts/action-af-extension.py
"""
Custom extension for ZAP Action-AF with organization-specific features.
"""

import json
import requests
from typing import Dict, List, Any

class ActionAFExtension:
    def __init__(self, config_file: str):
        with open(config_file, 'r') as f:
            self.config = json.load(f)
            
    def custom_vulnerability_scoring(self, alert: Dict) -> Dict:
        """Apply custom vulnerability scoring logic."""
        base_score = self._get_base_score(alert)
        
        # Apply business context
        business_impact = self._assess_business_impact(alert)
        
        # Apply environmental factors
        env_factor = self._get_environmental_factor(alert)
        
        # Calculate custom score
        custom_score = base_score * business_impact * env_factor
        
        alert['custom_scoring'] = {
            'base_score': base_score,
            'business_impact': business_impact,
            'environmental_factor': env_factor,
            'final_score': custom_score,
            'risk_classification': self._classify_risk(custom_score)
        }
        
        return alert
    
    def intelligent_false_positive_detection(self, alerts: List[Dict]) -> List[Dict]:
        """Use ML model to detect false positives."""
        processed_alerts = []
        
        for alert in alerts:
            # Feature extraction
            features = self._extract_features(alert)
            
            # ML prediction
            fp_probability = self._predict_false_positive(features)
            
            # Apply confidence threshold
            if fp_probability < self.config['fp_threshold']:
                alert['false_positive_probability'] = fp_probability
                alert['recommendation'] = 'investigate'
                processed_alerts.append(alert)
            else:
                alert['false_positive_probability'] = fp_probability
                alert['recommendation'] = 'likely_false_positive'
                # Optional: still include but mark as low priority
                if self.config['include_likely_fps']:
                    processed_alerts.append(alert)
                    
        return processed_alerts
    
    def compliance_mapping(self, alerts: List[Dict]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Map vulnerabilities to compliance frameworks."""
        compliance_mapping = {}
        
        frameworks = self.config['compliance_frameworks']
        
        for framework in frameworks:
            compliance_mapping[framework] = self._map_to_framework(alerts, framework)
            
        return compliance_mapping
    
    def generate_remediation_guidance(self, alert: Dict) -> Dict[str, str]:
        """Generate specific remediation guidance."""
        guidance = {
            'immediate_actions': [],
            'code_changes': [],
            'configuration_updates': [],
            'monitoring_recommendations': []
        }
        
        # Use knowledge base to generate guidance
        kb_guidance = self._query_knowledge_base(alert)
        if kb_guidance:
            guidance.update(kb_guidance)
            
        # Add organization-specific guidance
        org_guidance = self._get_organizational_guidance(alert)
        if org_guidance:
            guidance['organizational_requirements'] = org_guidance
            
        return guidance

Conclusion​

Implementing DAST with OWASP ZAP and GitHub Actions provides:

  • Automated Security Testing: Continuous vulnerability detection
  • CI/CD Integration: Security gates in deployment pipeline
  • Comprehensive Coverage: Multiple scanning approaches
  • Actionable Results: Detailed reports and integration options
  • Scalable Solution: Supports multiple applications and environments

This approach enables organizations to shift security left and maintain robust security posture throughout the development lifecycle.

Key Benefits of ZAP Action-AF Integration:

  • Advanced Filtering: Intelligent false positive reduction
  • Enterprise Features: Compliance mapping and advanced reporting
  • Seamless Integration: Built-in support for security orchestration platforms
  • Scalable Architecture: Supports complex multi-environment deployments
  • Enhanced Automation: ML-enhanced vulnerability assessment and prioritization
